newsitem.title: USA: Coordinated Health cancels Escalator deal.
newsitem.headline: Coordinated Health cancels Escalator deal.

text.p: Privately-held Coordinated HealthCare Inc said Monday it canceled its planned merger with Escalator Inc.
The merger would have combined the two companies via an issuance of Escalator common stock in exchange for all Coordinated HealthCare's stock.

"We are very sorry that we had to take this action, but we feel that we have not received the proper attention and timely response for due diligence informational requests," Coordinated HealthCare Chief Executive Thomas Taule said in a statement.
Escalator Chief Executive Howard Scala said merger talks, which his company announced May 2, broke down late Friday.
"Apparently (Coordinate HealthCare) decided to cut the cord directly," Scala said. He declined to eleborate on the reason for the breakdown in talks.
Escalator shares fell 5/32 to 1-13/32 in late morning activity.
